thread.title: ETA CEO Jason Oxman Discusses Payments Security on C-Span
thread.title_full: ETA CEO Jason Oxman Discusses Payments Security on C-Span

author: syndicated
title: ETA CEO Jason Oxman Discusses Payments Security on C-Span
text:
Posted by syndicated on Sep 28th, 2015 in Syndicated Posts | 0 comments 
September 28, 2015 – C-Span’s Washington Journal hosted ETA CEO Jason Oxman as today’s featured guest. Speaking with Pedro Echevarria about data breaches, financial data, the chip-card migration and the October 1 liability-shift date, Oxman provided a high-level overview of the migration to chip or “EMV” cards and the road ahead for payments security. Oxman explained some of the many technologies beyond EMV being implemented to keep transactions safe including tokenization and end-to-end encryption. 
Other issues addressed in the segment included precisely how a merchant goes about making the upgrade to accept chip-cards, the risks of not upgrading, card-not-present fraud, the rise mobile payments and payments technology regulation. 
Watch the entire conversation here: http://www.c-span.org/video/?328234-5/washington-journal-jason-oxman-computer-breaches-financial-data 
For additional information, please contact Meghan Cieslak, ETA Director of Communications at mcieslak@electran.org Share this:
